result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lona Michelle Siebenthal

records.addlTxt:
8:59 AM Cases 21CF96, 21TR285, and 22CF125 called together.  Defendant Lona Michelle Siebenthal in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Lona Michelle Siebenthal.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Taber- def to plead to Ct 1 OWI 5 in 21CF96, remaining cases to be DRI, parties requesting PSI, State is capped at PSI.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Off the record 9:04 AM, back on the record 9:10 AM, same appearances as previously noted. Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 21CF96 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI. Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Def requests all in person sentencing; Atty Taber requests 2 hours for sentencing.  Bond is revoked.  Def must be remanded into custody today.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
from Medical Center
Medical documentation

Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Taber notes a suppression motion was filed in 21CF96, asks for a motion hearing.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

01:37 PM Defendant, Lona Michelle Siebenthal, appeared.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Def indicated, off the record, that her ct-appointed atty in another matter is willing to take this case upon Court appointment.  Court will appoint atty Renee Taber, def understands she must make the ordered payments each month.  Court adjourns.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
OSPD report- not eligible
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

Defendant must post $1,000 new cash bond to cover this matter only.  All conditions of previous bonds (in cases on with Judge John Anderson) are to apply to this bond as well:  No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, substances, or paraphernalia.  Subject to testing by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon reasonable suspicion or arrest.  No driving without a valid driver's license.
